steps.title: Mix baking soda and water.
steps.content: Mix baking soda and water. You may have to experiment to get the texture you want. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add mint flavoring or whatever flavor you want your mouthwash to taste like.
steps.content: Add mint flavoring or whatever flavor you want your mouthwash to taste like. Just be sure that your flavoring has no sugar in it. [2] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source

steps.title: Measure out 1 tablespoon of mouthwash and gargle for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
steps.content: Measure out 1 tablespoon of mouthwash and gargle for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

steps.title: Add herbs and seeds, infuse for 20 minutes.
steps.content: Add herbs and seeds, infuse for 20 minutes. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Cool, strain and use as a gargle/mouthwash.
steps.content: Cool, strain and use as a gargle/mouthwash.

steps.title: Double or triple the recipe and add 1 teaspoon of tincture of myrrh as a natural preservative, if you wish to make up a larger quantity.
steps.content: Double or triple the recipe and add 1 teaspoon of tincture of myrrh as a natural preservative, if you wish to make up a larger quantity.

steps.title: Add glycerine and aloe vera gel.
steps.content: Add glycerine and aloe vera gel. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove from the heat, let cool slightly.
steps.content: Remove from the heat, let cool slightly.

steps.title: Add spearmint oil.
steps.content: Add spearmint oil. [5] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Get a small glass of drinking water.
steps.content: Get a small glass of drinking water.

steps.title: Squeeze a little of your everyday toothpaste into your glass.
steps.content: Squeeze a little of your everyday toothpaste into your glass. Use roughly the same amount you'd need to brush your teeth.

steps.title: Put a small amount of water in your mouth along with the paste.
steps.content: Put a small amount of water in your mouth along with the paste. Work with your cheeks and tongue to break up the toothpaste. Then swoosh inside your mouth for 30 seconds (do not gargle). If needed, use a toothbrush to help break it down but be careful not to gag.

steps.title: Spit it all out.
steps.content: Spit it all out. Again, do not swallow. Your mouth should feel wonderfully refreshed.
